page.title: 01Sparkwell,Lutton,Hemerdon.
page.content: Of these three villages Sparkwell is the largest. (Details of each village can be found under separate headings.) The area is largely given over to dairy farming with some beef cattle and sheep. There is a small amount of coniferous woodland grown for its timber and a larger amount of deciduous woodland. To the north of the area there is a china clay works which also supplies a concrete block making works. Just north of Sparkwell village is a large open-cast wolfram mine which was closed down after the Second World War. Recent proposals to re-open this mine have been met with opposition by conservation groups. A decision by the government is expected shortly. Sparkwell small primary school is threatened by falling rolls.
